review: Advised properly regarding diet and physically exercise to be increased. Advised me to take 3 to 4 tests.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Dr Virendra Kumar Raju treated me for Pneumonia.
He timely took the decision to recommend my admission in Ayushman Hospital, Dwarka. He treated me with utmost care.

I would recommend him as he takes right decisions and good care. Without his carefulness and seriousness in my case, I could have ended on ventilator.

God bless him.

tags: Wait time,
review: i am happy with the friendiness,but i feel i cannot able to explain my issue so he could not understand the issue.because i am still feeling some symptoms

tags: Value for money,Wait time,
review: Doctor asked for a consultation fee again to review the test reports that he prescribed in the first visit and I visited him back just 2 days after that. **** ******* ****** ******** **** * ****** **** *** ************ *** ***** ** ****** *** **** ******* *** *** ***** ***** **** ********** ** ***** *** * ************** *** I would recommend that people should avoid visiting him as you will be prescribed a series of tests in the first visit and then you have to pay the consultation fee again for the review of those test reports

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
Have't come across more unfriendly Doc than Dr. Raju. Had consultations (to review our Blood Reports for self and wife (both Sr. Citizens) with him on 05 and 06 Jun 23 at Ayushman Hospital Sectr 10, Dwarka. 
He didn't spend more than 3 minutes to review two reports running into 16 pages each. For my wife's Urine RE Report (which clearly had indications of UTI), he stated that this sample appears to have been contaminated and advised re-test.
Approached him with Urine report the very nest day which had identical results. i.i. indicating signs of UTI. The Doc. did not spend more than 30 secs to review the reports and stated that we should approach him when there are possible indications of UTI without even stating what are those indications and what to do do to avoid such infections. These basically forms part of doctor's duties to advise the patients what to do and what to avoid in case of any medical situations.
********  *** *** ***** ***** ** **** ********* **** ***** the more patients he sees in lesser time, better for him. ** ** *** ********* *** *** ******* ** ******** *** **** ******* *** ****** ** ********** ***** ** ******** ********** **** *** *** ***** **** *** ******** *** ************* ***** *********** * ****** **** ** ******** *** ******** ***** ******* *****

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: Visites this doctor for fever ** **** ** **** *********** **** * *** ***** ******* **** *** ** *** ****** *** when I visited him for loose motion issue he again charged me Rs.1000 and I told him that seems like I have food poisoning and he suggested some tests and on the basis of those did get to know swelling in intestine and little infection in pancreas. Initially he said the meds prescribed earlier will be fine *** ** **** ** **** **** ******** *** ***** *** ***** ******** he tole me finish these and let me know your condition after 2 more days for which he was going to charge again i****** ** ****** **** ******* *** ********* ** *** **** *** *** **** ***** *** ***** ***** ** **** *** when  I was leaving he asked me do you have medical insurance for which I said YES he immediately said so get admitted to hospital it will be good there are chances that the meds will not work. After which I visited another doc *** ** ********** **** ** ***** *** *** *** * *** ********* **** ***** * ********* *** ****** **** ***** **** *** ** ****** ** ** ***** ******* *** *** * *******

I visited second day to show ultrasound report, he charged again Rs 1000 . Ultrasound was done his recommendation but he said ultrasound is not reliable and go for CT for a minor issue, which was not essential

review: We visited doctor for legs pain,thyroid n blood pressure problem..n having mild fever but doctor diagonsed of sore throat cough n fever ***** ** ****** **** ******* *** *** *** ******** **** ***** * **** *********he forcefully tried to prove it a corona case...such an aweful experiance....
reply_text:
Doctor will judge as per medical science and investigations are advised as per condition . Patient is free to make his own decision regarding his medical condition. Fever should be investigated as per diseases prevalent. Not agreeing is fine and not hearing and not agreeing also is fine but aweful is terrible experience as no one force anyone for anything,advise is advise . U take it or leave it. But missing COVID in situation of fever is very terrible thing which a doctor cannot do. Testing is advised by all authorities also and whole world is aware of
Thanks for ur feedback 
People will come to know that fever and no testing of COVID is itself a aweful thing !
